text: The Belfast Charity Cup was a football competition which ran from 1883 to 1941, and was based on a similar tournament in Scotland, the Glasgow Merchants Charity Cup. The competition was open to senior sides from Belfast and invited intermediate teams. ==List of champions== * 1883–84 Cliftonville * 1884–85 Oldpark * 1885–86 Cliftonville * 1886–87 Cliftonville * 1887–88 Cliftonville * 1888–89 Cliftonville * 1889–90 Black Watch * 1890–91 Linfield * 1891–92 Linfield * 1892–93 Linfield * 1893–94 Linfield * 1894–95 Linfield * 1895–96 Glentoran * 1896–97 Cliftonville * 1897–98 North Staffordshire Regiment * 1898–99 Linfield * 1899–00 Distillery * 1900–01 Linfield * 1901–02 Glentoran * 1902–03 Linfield * 1903–04 Belfast Celtic * 1904–05 Linfield * 1905–06 Cliftonville * 1906–07 Glentoran * 1907–08 Cliftonville * 1908–09 Cliftonville * 1909–10 Belfast Celtic * 1910–11 Glentoran * 1911–12 Belfast Celtic * 1912–13 Linfield * 1913–14 Linfield * 1914–15 Linfield * 1915–16 Distillery * 1916–17 Linfield * 1917–18 Linfield * 1918–19 Linfield * 1919–20 Belfast Celtic * 1920–21 Distillery * 1921–22 Linfield * 1922–23 Glentoran * 1923–24 Cliftonville * 1924–25 Glentoran * 1925–26 Belfast Celtic / Glentoran (shared) * 1926–27 Linfield * 1927–28 Linfield * 1928–29 Distillery / Glentoran (shared) * 1929–30 Linfield * 1930–31 Distillery * 1931–32 Belfast Celtic * 1932–33 Linfield * 1933–34 Linfield * 1934–35 Linfield * 1935–36 Belfast Celtic / Linfield (shared) * 1936–37 Belfast Celtic * 1937–38 Linfield * 1938–39 Belfast Celtic * 1939–40 Belfast Celtic * 1940–41 Belfast Celtic ===Performance by club=== {|class="wikitable" ! style="background:silver;" | Team ! style="background:silver;" | No. of wins ! style="background:silver;" | Winning years |- ||Linfield|| 24 ||1890–91, 1891–92, 1892–93, 1893–94, 1894–95, 1898–99, 1900–01, 1902–03, 1904–05, 1912–13, 1913–14, 1914–15, 1916–17, 1917–18, 1918–19, 1921–22, 1926–27, 1927–28, 1929–30, 1932–33, 1933–34, 1934–35, 1935–36 (shared), 1937–38 |- ||Belfast Celtic|| 11 ||1903–04, 1909–10, 1911–12, 1919–20, 1925–26 (shared), 1931–32, 1935–36 (shared), 1936–37, 1938–39, 1939–40, 1940–41 |- ||Cliftonville|| 10 ||1883–84, 1885–86, 1886–87, 1887–88, 1888–89, 1896–97, 1905–06, 1907–08, 1908–09, 1923–24 |- ||Glentoran|| 8 ||1895–96, 1901–02, 1906–07, 1910–11, 1922–23, 1924–25, 1925–26 (shared), 1928–29 (shared) |- ||Distillery|| 5 ||1899–00, 1915–16, 1920–21, 1928–29, 1930–31 |- ||Black Watch|| 1 ||1889–90 |- |||| 1 ||1897–98 |- ||Oldpark|| 1 ||1884–85 |} ==Sources== *Malcolm Brodie, "100 Years of Irish Football", Blackstaff Press, Belfast (1980) ==References== Category:Defunct association football cup competitions in Northern Ireland
